intro: [WRONG START] Verbascum × couum, commonly known as the common mullein. It is a hybrid plant in the genus Verbascum, characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, fuzzy, gray-green leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Verbascum × coum is known for its medicinal uses and has been historically used to treat respiratory conditions.
